page.title: 17COGGESHALL SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The Coggeshall sewage works was built in 1979. It is all computer run and only two men come in once a month to see if it is all working. The sewage comes in from Kelvedon, Coggeshall, and Coggeshall Hamlet. It comes from industrial waste and domestic waste. First it comes through the three pipes one from Kelvedon, one from Coggeshall and one from Coggeshall Hamlet. Preliminary treatment is when the sewage comes through the pipes and in to the screening process which removes rags it then goes into the tanks which removes all the grit and it goes through some pipes and into a hopper. Primary treatment removes the sludge into large sludge tanks which are 4 metres deep. In the secondary treatment water spreads out and cleans up the sewage ready to re-enter the river.
